description: a(n) = maximal length of partitions of n into distinct primes or -1 if there is no such partition.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2000
example: a(12) = 3 because 12 = 2+3+7, but 12 is not a sum of 4 or more distinct primes.
author: _Clark Kimberling_
extensions: Offset changed and edited by _Alois P. Heinz_, Nov 13 2012
